DataElement.preferredDefinition: Describes a location in the mouth that is toward the back and to the cheek side._is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar._The crest of the gingiva surrounding a tooth_An abnormal deepening of a gingival sulcus._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Describes a location in the mouth that is toward the back and to the tongue side._The area of a tooth where the enamel of the crown and the cementum of the root(s) are joined._Relating to or located at the tip (an apex). (On-line Medical Dictionary)_a single character text field to record data.

The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.

The pores are visible but not large. The skin texture is neither fine or thick and it neither feels dry or oily to the touch.
